00102 /* Fall back to locale-driven messages. The symbol GREEK is only kept
00103  * here for traditional purposes. The Greek messages are in the CP737
00104  * encoding and thus not very useful in this day and age. */
00105 
00106 #if ENABLE_NLS
00107 #  undef GREEK
00108 #endif
00109

00117 #ifdef GREEK
00118 #define ERRORMESSAGE \
00119         "\033[0;1;31;5m¨¦©¦®ã: \033[0;1;31m" \
00120         "‹ ¡¨å© £¦ ©­á¢£˜ œ£§æ› ©œ «¤ ¦¢¦¡¢ã¨à© «ª œ¨š˜©å˜ª.\n" \
00121         "         ˜¨˜¡˜¢¦ç£œ œ¤£œ¨é©«œ «¦¤ •œ ¨ ©«ã ‘¬©«ã£˜«¦ª š ˜ « ª\n" \
00122         "         ©¬¤Ÿã¡œª §¦¬ «¦ ›£ ¦ç¨š©˜¤. …«¦ç£œ ©¬šš¤é£ š ˜ «¤\n" \
00123         "         «˜¢˜ §à¨å˜.\033[0;1m\n\n"
00124 #else
00125 #define ERRORMESSAGE \
00126         _("\033[0;1;31;5mCaution: \033[0;1;31m" \
00127           "A non-fatal error has interrupted this process.\n" \
00128           "         Please notify the Sysop about the conditions\n" \
00129           "         that led to it. We apologise for the inconvenience." \
00130           "\033[0;1m\n\n")
00131 #endif /* GREEK */
